newsitem.title: USA: Faulding gets FDA ok to market captopril.
newsitem.headline: Faulding gets FDA ok to market captopril.

text.p: Faulding Inc said on Wednesday that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has granted marketing approval for captopril tablets, which treat hypertension, heart failure and left ventricular dysfunction.
Faulding's 12.5 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg and 100 mg captopril tablets are the generic equivalent of Capoten tablets marketed by Bristol-Myers Squibb Co, Faulding said.

Reported generic sales of captopril tablets in 1996 totaled $96.8 million, Faulding said. There are currently 20 other manufacturers holding approved abbreviated new drug applications for this product, Faulding said.
Faulding said it is assessing the commercial potential for captopril tablets.
